job_title: Business Development Associate in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: The job is very flexible. As a business student, I was able to gain experience while continuing my education. For the most part, you create your own schedule according to the project you are on and time you may need off for personal/school reasons.
cons:
CMU-RC is a not-for-profit organization so the compensation is very low compared to similar positions at other consulting firms. When a dedicated co-worker asked for a raise for doing tasks that were outside of his job description and should have been performed by his supervisor, management denied him. Their excuse: "we are paying you in experience".  Employee moral and satisfaction is not a priority, especially for intern positions. 

Unfortunately, CMU-RC tries to provide the services of a consulting/ market research firm, but they lack the resources for their employees to provide these services.

job_title: Student Services Advisor in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: CMU is like a second family.  Everyone is very welcoming, friendly and collaborative.  Salary is comparable, or even more, than other institutions in the region/state.  Benefits are excellent.  Management is very open to new ideas/taking 'risks' and encouraging of professional development (on that note, great, numerous opportunities for professional development are available and advertised to ALL employees).
cons: I really cannot pinpoint any.  This isn't the case for my area (Enrollment and Student Services), but I have heard that one or two departments on-campus are not the "best" to work in regarding the overall work environment (i.e. power struggles, management and employees not seeing eye-to-eye)...  I'm only going by what I have heard, though, and not seen myself.

review_title: I absolutely loved working for Central Michigan University because of the young employees and the positive attitude.
job_title: Student Activity Center Employee in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Central Michigan University constantly strives for professional development in every position.  Central worked well around my crazy student schedule, and my advisers were willing to help with any life situation that interfered with work.  I also loved the employee scheduling system: when to work.
cons: There were not guaranteed hours, which did not make paying bills easy.  There were also too many   employees hired for the fitness specialist position.

job_title: Administration in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Fantastic benefits: health, dental, life, etc., tuition reimbursement, employee training programs, healthy lifestyle incentive programs, the list goes on!  Great opportunities for advancement.  Supportive culture.  An employee can get as much out of their employment as they put into it; the opportunities are everywhere, it is up to you to take advantage of the many opportunities offered!
cons: Some union mentality impedes progress on a lower level - for example, having to wait for an office worker to make a call because that is their job duty.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: I got my Masters in Mathematics from CMU and I am currently working on my Doctorate in the same area. I have worked here for going abotu 6 years now and I have no regrets whatsoever. Great environment with possibilities to grow, relate with people of varying backgrounds and test your limits. Thank you CMU!
cons: At this time, I do not have any cons to register.

job_title: Office Assistant in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Working an office job at CMU is a great experience. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and always willing to lend a hand. I came out of this job with a number of skills that I didn't have when I came in, particularly organizational skills.
cons: Oftentimes there was little to do, which isn't a terrible thing since I was able to get homework done. I also didn't find my job particularly challenging, which is a must if you're looking not just to make some money while you're a student, but to gain some practical knowledge that will benefit you in the future.

review_title: Great place to work and learn.
job_title: in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: It is an educational institution, so many highly educated individuals work there.  There is always someone, somewhere, than can answer your questions if you have one.
cons: It's a public institution, so every penny that is spent is scrutinized.  There is often money appropriated to things that don't matter at the expense of things that do--like IT.

review_title: The university is very flexible with students, however the pay is pretty low.
job_title: Student Computer Technician in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: CMU has a very flexible environment and the work that students perform is relatively easy. There is not a lot of stress involved in the OIT, which has made the last 3 years a great learning experience.
cons: Getting promoted is pretty difficult, and they do give you a run around if you are ever on the edge of actually getting promoted. I would also have to say that the pay is super weak across the board. For some reason, the university salaries are way lower than average across the board.

job_title: Computer Repair Technician in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: You learnt while you worked, so it did work out like a double edge sword, a lot of benefit for me especially because it was in the field that I really like. I also enjoyed working with the people around me, they valued me high, they let me tried to do the best I could do. Hey, nobody's perfect, and what's more, I was learning while I was working, so that really were great! My Boss also were very understandable, he gave me flexible hours, and also depending on the second job I had, I could record my time and submit it to the next period. Overall, it was great!
cons: No downside at all. I guess it's more or less just from my own downsides, because when you're taking classes and tried to earn extra money, sometimes it's not easy, but again, as I mentioned above - I was willing to work and my Boss gave me flexible hours, also flexible billing time. For me, that worked great!

review_title: Same Terrible Trend of a Lack of Tenure Track Positions
job_title: Full Time Temporary Professor in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: The facilities are really good with a few strong faculty who have vision for where the art department could go.
cons: A lack of initiative to bring the art department to where it could be to keep up with other institutions. Typical of too many higher ed institutions currently, CMU hires temporary full time employees in place of what should be tenure track positions, allowing insulting pay with high expectations and no job security.

job_title: Executive Secretary in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: The tuition assistance, opportunity for workshops and to take classes flexible with work schedule most of the time
cons: Budget cuts and rate freezes taken by staff. Opportunity for raises minimal and depend on supervisors

review_title: Positive work environment, tuition reimbursement rounds it out to make it a good benefit package.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros:
Tuition reimbursement (24 credits a year) makes it possible for employees to advance their education while working for CMU. 
The vision of the university is positive, and this gives you the possibility to work for values that you admire.
cons:
Lots of office politics, need to watch what you say and to who.
People are not always recognized for their hard work.

review_title: It is a great place to work in terms of scheduling and ease of tasks.
job_title: Building Maintenance Worker in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: The best thing about working for Central Michigan is scheduling availability. Working with generally good people. Learning new things all the time.
cons: Receiving too much negative feedback. Supervisors are 'old school' and don't realize that their managerial styles are out dated and new approaches need to be taken.

review_title: Easy way to make money while going to school.
job_title: Campus Dining
pros:
Flexible hours, Relaxed work environment, Variety of opportunities, One free meal per day.
Able to pick up extra shifts or take shifts off when needed.
cons: You only make minimum wage, Management can sometimes play the favoritism game, Some coworkers (other students) can be incompetent. Fin

job_title: Team Leader in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: I made a lot of good friends while working at the Market. Working on Campus allows you to have more freedom during the holidays.
cons: I had some very racial motivated encounters while working at the Market. I reported them only to find out there were other reports on this person. This person is still an employee and absolutely nothing was done about it. In fact, they were given more responsibility and praise.

job_title: Resident Assistant in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Free room and board. You make lasting memories and you are seen as a role model for students. Great preparation for a real job with many co-workers.
cons: Can be stressful and time-consuming depending on your commitment. Beginning and ending of the year can be hell. Some deadlines for work to be done.

job_title: Assistant Systems Administrator in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: The job was like a sandbox. I could play with the newest Technologies and incorporate them into a Production setting.
cons: Cons here are hard to come by. My biggest complaint was working with people that didn't necessarily want to be there. This doesn't have much to do with the job itself.

review_title: They are reshaping health care and training new physicians in mid-Michigan,
job_title: Clinical Medical Faculty in Saginaw, MI
pros: Collegial, connected to a new medical school, good salary/benefits, pension, and quality affiliate hospitals.
cons: The clinical medical faculty (doctors of medicine) don't have the same educational benefits as the basic science faculty and other employees.

job_title: Team Leader in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Flexible hours. Convenient schedule painting. Food/drink benefits. No work on holidays. Coworkers always make the job fun.
cons: Very low pay for the amount of work. Managers that don't treat you the best, or acknowledge input. Customers also are not the best.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: The department offers a good variety of research opportunities including the opportunity to spend some time working in the NSCL at MSU. Ready and willing to work with students in a welcoming atmosphere. Breadth of experience available.
cons: Low pay for an assistantship.

job_title: Textbook Clerk in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Free books on loan every semester
cons: Extremely cliquey, departments either dislike one another or pretend that the others do not exist, management is a bunch of mildly educated townies each on a power trip, seniority plays zero role in your hourly wages, temporary employees brought in for extra help during high-volume times make the same amount of money as you no matter how long you've worked there

job_title: Team Leader in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Flexible hours as a student and it is a great place to work as a student.  Will work around your class schedule.
cons: Pay could be better and the attendance policy is strict for students if they have a time conflict. There are mandatory work days for students.

job_title: Cook's Assistant in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros:
Positive working environment, 
large staff,
free meals when you work more than three hours, which really helps the average poor college student who is always hungry
lots of promotions to pick up extra hours
cons: Central Michigan university pays their employees with food and minimum wage. If you don't have a meal plan, it is great, but if you do it is just a minimum wage job.

review_title: Excellent supervisor, really flexible and the best experience I've had with a supervisor
job_title: Library Technician in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: A good work eniviroment, you will gain alot of experience working here. Once your done with your work you will have time to study for classes.
cons: The only con is the amount of pay and the amount of hours you can get. The library is a stickler when it comes to not going past 20 hours.

job_title: Painter in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Are willing to work with schedules, the managers are very laid back and non-demanding, work is done at one's own pace.
cons: There is very low pay, but other than that everything about working here is positive. I've met lifelong friends working for Central

job_title: Building Maintenance Worker in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: I worked a number of positions at CMU and the one thing that stood out to me was that each involved working with great people.
cons: I didn't experience many cons. They can be pretty stingy with the amount of hours that they allow students to work.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Work almost as many hours as you want, ability to work on class related activities during work if no one was needing help, and the pay was almost tax free.
cons: Honestly, really none.  They management was open to ideas and gave you the freedom to do what you needed to do to help students in the lab

review_title: Graduate Assistant: Foreign Languages Literatures and Cultures Department
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: I absolutely loved working as a graduate assistant in this department. Everyone was very helpful and supportive. I learned a lot! All in all a great experience.
cons: Obviously being an instructor for a class, you can't pick your students. Sometimes you can get people that are unwilling to participate and can ruin the learning experience for others.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Chicago, IL

cons: Sometimes the work was frustrating because it is IT work. But that is not really the employers fault or managers, it is just the nature of the work.

job_title: Graphic Designer in Mount Pleasant, MI

I have experience working with clients, sales representatives, and lead designers. Works with my school schedule very well.
cons: Pay is only minimum wage and there is no relationship/minimal talk with clients.

job_title: Teaching Assistant/Research Assistant in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: I enjoyed the opportunity of teaching an undergraduate class during the final year of my master's program. Shared office space with amazing colleagues. Got to work with great professors.
cons: Need more investment to organize quality departmental seminars for graduate and advanced undergraduate students.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Award-winning company that regularly puts out outstanding work. Working for CMLife will give you an opportunity to work with the outstanding students that produce this work and CMLife will teach you how to produce award-winning work as well.
cons: Lack of communication and organization. Get everything in writing, otherwise the plans will change the next time you talk to your boss.

job_title: Student Supervisor in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: I worked for CMU during my undergrad and I truly don't believe that I could have had a more flexible job. It allowed me to gain professional experience while also allowing me to maintain my schoolwork.
cons: Hours are limited and the amount of work expected of you can be a bit overwhelming at times.

job_title: Advisor in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: CMU is very supportive of its employees and families.  They provide excellent professional and personal development opportunities. A great place to work.
cons: There are no concerns at this time.

job_title: in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: The offices I worked for are well aware that being a student comes first so they are very flexible with working around your schedule. 40 hours a week in the Summer, 25 max during the school year.
cons: As a student, expect minimum wage. Depending on where you work, the job really was just a resume builder.

job_title: Technology Support Analyst in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Good place to work. People are very nice and respectful. Dress code. Bosses are good too.
cons: My boss asked me not to talk in my mother tongue (hindi) with other Indian guy. Except that no complaints. He was a good boss.

review_title: Friendly work environment with dedicated staff.
job_title: Advisor in Mount Pleasant, MI

cons: Still trying to figure out best way to work between departments to reach common goals and objectives to benefit university. Some disconnect between departments.

job_title: Systems Architect in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: They gave me permission to work anything I want to. I have learnt many things here in Central.
cons: I haven't found anything specific related to downsides at CMU. We work as good team to put the university top rated.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Washington, DC
pros: Worked in a great department. Cost of living is cheap. Flexible hours. Room to take the imitative as a grad assistant.
cons: Like any work place the bureaucracy is daunting to deal with in a university. Admin do not really care about the professors which degrades the student experience.

job_title: Web Development Intern in Ypsilanti, MI

cons: I don't have much to say for cons.  The pay was lower than I would have preferred, but I believe most student workers at the university receive minimum wage.

job_title: Library Systems Student Tech in Mount Pleasant, MI

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Mount Pleasant, MI
